tweets.text: Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.

Some reflections on reaching the milestone of 300000 homes better protected from flooding. My heart felt thanks to all of those involved be you in the supply chain, local authority, drainage board, community group - and of course those fab folk in #TeamEA https://t.co/w9aLnmKQ04 https://t.co/HWLf1MpjnO

urls.title: Better protecting communities across the nation
urls.description: In today's blog EA Executive Director for Local Operations John Curtin, celebrates the milestone of having better protected more than 300,000 homes from flooding and coastal erosion

tweets.text: This is the lake that was polluted when @HS2 were drilling bore holes @EnvAgency covered it up saying they saw no signs of pollution so the press stopped looking into it because they believe the Environment Agency really hoping our worst fears do not come to fruition https://t.co/JvR3nxoBmv https://t.co/1QQVCsQ4ie

"More than 14,000 breaches of environmental permits occurred in 2019".

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/GGDmeZkvTe

@AndyDAgorne @katerav @DorindaDorinda @york_travel @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkCycle @iTravelYork Shocked to see the amount of works going on just to make what was supposed to be a parking area  for construction vehicles. It looks scarily permanent.

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

tweets.text:
Our NatureBid auction closes on Sun 28th!

Landowners and farmers in the Upper Aire, you can now submit your funding bids for natural flood management and water quality improvement.

More info here: https://t.co/pBJQjFTEiw

@EnvAgencyYNE @SylvaFoundation

urls.title: NatureBid project to improve water quality and flood management | Yorkshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: We are pleased to announce a new pilot project which awards funding to landowners in the Upper Aire to improve water quality and flood management.

tweets.text: @stwater Hi, I'm not sure of the details but it may be best reaching out to @RedIndustries2. Our local area is blighted by significant bad odour. Coincidentally we have a landfill nearby - but the operator reported today that they believe the odour is ground water related. @StinkStopthe
@katerav @DorindaDorinda @york_travel @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkCycle @iTravelYork Most recent date I have been given is Apr 12th.

This morning was the virtual opening of the Hythe Ranges sea defence scheme. It represents our largest volume of low carbon concrete used in a flood scheme helping protect people from #climate shocks + reducing our carbon footprint https://t.co/M6g20Tbm8B #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/3UozuAZnMz

urls.title: Hythe Ranges sea defence scheme virtual opening ceremony
urls.description: Scheme will better protect 787 properties in the area
